content.raw: I know this is only tangentially related, but what happens if someone sets `(255, -1, 128)` or similar? \(some combination of using negative numbers\). I ask because I've seen `QColor` behave differently across different versions of PyQt \(although I can’t say I’ve ever tried with negative numbers\), and so wonder if such a combination might crash programs on certain installs. It might be worth adding a check for a valid colour and assuming anything else is also the default \(not just `(-1, -1, -1)`\).
